subject: Ethics
title: The Belmont Report Basics
description: A fast breakdown of The Belmont Report Basics for builders.

hook.text: For 40 years, U.S. doctors told Black men they were treating their syphilis. They were just watching.

buildup.text: The Tuskegee study's exposure in 1972 shocked America and demanded new ethical safeguards.

discovery.text: The 1979 Belmont Report outlined three core principles: respect for persons, beneficence, and justice.

twist.text: Tuskegee violated all threeâ€”no consent, no benefit, and the burden fell entirely on a vulnerable group.

climax.text: The Belmont Report now governs all federally funded U.S. research involving human subjects.

punchline.text: One horrific study rewrote the rules for every study after.

quiz.question: What event directly led to the creation of the Belmont Report?
options: The exposure of the Tuskegee syphilis study
